awd_titl_txt: Taxonomic Monograph of Antillean Species of Miconia sect.   Chaenopleura (Melastomataceae)
awd_abstract_narration: Miconia (family Melastomaceae) is a large and diverse genus                of tropical shrubs, some of which are relatively rare.  The genus               itself is not well-marked and probably is not monophyletic.  In                 addition, the intrageneric boundaries are unclear with respect to               assignment of the species to the various sections.  Therefore, the              genus is in need of in-depth taxonomic revision.  The PI proposes               to initiate this task with an analysis of phylogenetic                          relationships among the species of section Chaenopleura, which is               restricted to the West Indies.  This aspect of the investigation                will be based primarily on gross morphology and will involve the                use of mainland species to polarize character transformations and               parsimony-analyses to derive patterns of evolution in the genus.                The PI then proposes to revise the section based on his                         phylogenetic analysis; to write a monograph to include complete,                detailed descriptions; and to write a key to the species.  He and               a collaborator will collect fresh specimens for the study.
